reviews.review: Great game, great storyline, will blow your mind at the end

是谁杀了谁，而我又杀了谁？？？
是我杀了我！！！

Básicamente se aplica lo mismo que al primero, su combate está más pulido, pero el juego no para de hacer de éste su enfoque principal, salimos de todas las situaciones pegando tiros o con scripts narrativos. De verdad hubiera deseado que esta saga sea un walking simulator viendo como terminó resultando. Irónicamente, los primeros 15 minutos de juego, toda la introducción hasta antes de tomar tu primer arma, es lo que más me gustó del título.

Quel jeu... j'ai adoré du début à la fin. Ne connaissant BioShock que de nom, j'ai été curieuse de découvrir cette univers et je ne regrette absolument pas ! L'histoire est intéressante, il y a un bon gameplay bien plaisant d'ailleurs, les décors sont juste incroyable j'ai vraiment pris une claque visuelle à ce niveau là. Les personnages sont attachants.  C'est un pur régal d'y jouer, j'ai passé un bon moment dessus. 

Donc c'est avec un grand OUI, que je recommande ce jeu ! :3
伊丽莎白！！！！
Infinite is a beautiful game with a great story that you wont forget anytime soon. The two Burial at Sea DLCs are part of the story, so make sure to play those as well.

给大家搬运一下方便理解剧情
       Booker DeWitt剧情

　　1874年，4月19日。Booker DeWitt出生。

　　1890年，Booker参与了伤膝大屠杀，由于其对于土著印第安人残暴的行为，被冠以 "The White Injun"的称号。

　　伤膝战役小科普：Booker在16岁参军，在伤膝河战役时，Booker在犹豫该不该下手屠杀已经投降的平民，而中士此时面对所有人指责Booker拥有土著人的血统（所以才不下杀手）。为了不被朋友同僚嘲笑，Booker剥掉了土著人的皮，并点燃了仍有印第安人在内的帐篷。由于这一令人发指的行径，编队中的同僚，包括Cornelius Slate，给了他这个The White Injun（白皮印第安人）的称号，因为Booker喜欢从受害者身上收集战利品。

　　经过这次战役之后，Booker一直为当日的所作所为感到后悔。战役结束后，Booker带着内疚去参加一个小河中进行的洗礼，希望能够以新的身份重新开始生活。但是，在最后时刻，Booker拒绝了洗礼，认为自己的罪孽无法靠“浸在水里”消除。与此同时，另一个位面的Booker接受了洗礼，成为Comstock。

　　1892年1月，Booker成为 Pinkerton's National Detective Agency的一名侦探，由于在处理工人运动时利用极端的暴力手段而背负“盛名”。在为Pinkerton工作期间，他遇到一个女人，并很快的搞大了人家的肚子。结果该女子在生Anna时难产死了。这场悲剧结合Booker因平时滥用暴力的行为而被工作机构开除，Booker走向了自我堕落，沉迷于酗酒和赌博。

　　1893年，Booker成为了私人侦探，但债务高筑。在1893年10月, Robert Lutece 走进Booker的办公室，代表Comstock神父给了他一个用女儿Anna抵消所有债务的条件。出于绝望，Booker将女儿交给了Lutece和Comstock。Booker在Anna即将被Comstock带入传送门的最后一刻反悔，在与Comstock争抢Anna时，由于传送门的关闭，Anna在Booker的位面留下了一截被时空切断的手指，因为Anna获得了穿梭位面的能力。

　　Booker陷入更大的绝望，之后在自己的右手上烙印了AD两个字符来即纪念自己的女儿Anna DeWitt。20年之后，1912年，Lutece兄妹再次出现，开启了一个位面让Booker进入解救自己的女儿。进入位面时，Booker由于空间转换效应（由Lutece提出）失去了记忆同时捏造出了新的记忆。他将20年前卖女儿抵债的记忆和现在的解救女儿任务搞混，认为自己应该找到一个叫Elizabeth，并将她带去纽约，然后抵消自己的债务。

　　之后便是无限中发生的剧情，找到Elizabeth，E被SONGBIRD抓走，另一个位面被洗脑成功因为过度使用空间装置而加快衰老的Elizabeth将Booker召唤过去，让他将一个控制SONGBIRD的密码交给刚被抓走的E，之后E在得到密码后开启了全部的空间力量。在女神之塔被SONGBIRD摧毁后，SONGBIRD失控，试图攻击E和BOOKER，被E传送到深海中被水压挤死。

　　开启全部力量的E带领BOOKER走过灯塔的每一个门，BOOKER的记忆也慢慢回归，记起了自己当初卖掉女儿以及在争抢女儿时，Anna被切断小拇指的经过。他也想起来，E就是Anna，是自己的女儿。BOOKER被E带回当初接受洗礼的地方，BOOKER同样在最后时刻拒绝了洗礼，同时告诉E一切都结束了，COMSTOCK已经死了，他们可以一起去巴黎。E回答，comstock没有死，还活在千千万万的世界里。愤怒的BOOKER表示E所受的一切苦难都是COMSTOCK造成的，要将COMSTOCK淹死在摇篮里。E问BOOKER，是否真的决定要这么做，BOOKER给与了肯定的回答。

　　最终E将BOOKER带到“摇篮中的comstock”位面，BOOKER发现，是自己在小河中接受洗礼前的场景，他终于明白，自己在接受与不接受洗礼时产生了两个位面，只要这个做出决定前的BOOKER还活着，不接受洗礼的BOOKER和接受洗礼的COMSTOCK就会一直在不同的位面出现，E也会一直受苦。最终，BOOKER让所有位面的E将自己淹死在小河里。其他位面的E，由于BOOKER和COMSTOCK都不存在所以一个接一个的消失了，只有当前位面的E还存在着。

　　BOOKER在1893年10月8日，失去女儿的同一天醒来，他打开了ANNA的房门，见到ANNA的婴儿车还在屋内
Muy Buen Juego :)
와... 갓갓갓겜
剧情令人印象深刻

不用犹豫，是一部艺术。如果没玩过该系列，并打算只通本体，而不玩海葬DLC的话，只买3代就好了；否则其他情况建议从1代玩起。
第一人称射击游戏剧情向的游戏少，能做得令人印象深刻的，我个人觉得除了使命召唤，就是这生化奇兵。两者都有宏大的世界观，叹为观止的视觉享受，印在脑海里的剧情。
奇兵的剧情就不剧透，值得让人放空脑袋去体验那魔幻的哥伦比亚。
玩法就跟FPS一样，不同的是除了常规热武器还有类似魔法的异能攻击，玩过老滚5的玩家就深有体会，左键射击，右键魔法攻击，武器+异能的组合攻击就有十几种，总有一款适合你的；除了常规战斗外，还有非常棒的空轨战斗，喜欢空战的朋友就不要错过了，在空轨通道上滑行，像鹰一样寻找地上的敌人，瞄准，落下一击必杀，配合套装效果，简直就是个轰炸机，太爽了；如果胆小谨慎的玩家，也可以利用异能配合环境进行杀敌。
PC下按键有个小问题，有些按键是游戏锁死，无法更改，但只占很小的一部分，有需要改建操作的玩家需要“适应”。
在游戏中可以通过金币，升级武器和异能，但是不会所有都能一次升齐，因此找到适合自己的加以升级就好了，除了升级，还能购买子弹、回复HPMP等资源，但金币获取方式单一，主要靠捡别人落下的钱包皮夹，以及各大机构的保险箱。这里就不得不提到女主伊丽莎白，有玩家称她是游戏史上最好的NPC之一，确实如此，她会在游戏里提示你在哪有游戏道具，还会把捡到的钱扔给你，战斗中，缺子弹缺HP缺MP，都会无视距离给你扔一脸，还会在场景中创造利于你的战斗环境。
最后，这代游戏除了悲剧还是悲剧。给予的人生哲理就是，不要参与赌博，害已害人。
游戏很棒，一天推了一周目剧情感觉有点深奥还没怎么懂。

Completed this very quickly, and forgot to review it.. may as well amend that..
Bioshock infinite is all the bad things from the previous bioshock games mixed with all the good things from games they tried to copy (and failed at). It's a literal railtrack shooter insofar as you spend most of the game moving on rails and shooting things; honestly the dumbest concept i've seen in an FPS. The rest of the gameplay consists of picking up ridiculously overpowered abilities, then systematically blundering and blasting your way through hordes of mindless idiots that never so much as dive for cover.
The story is, for want of a better word, dumb. Not in an enjoyable, self-deprecating way or in an over the top slapstick way, but in a heinously cringey bible-bashing way. The game gives you 'moral choices' that are almost always binary and don't actually change the game in any meaningful way, and the characters are so two-dimensional that you'll wish you could just perma-die off one of those rails just to get away from how annoying they are.
The graphics are very pretty, but the game isn't as stable as previous incarnations and stutters in the oddest places even if you do have a rig that outmatches its preferred specs, but overall no complaints. the level design sucks; lots of closed environments that give the illusion of an open environment and rails...omg..so many rails..so lame..
The soundscape is pretty decent, and the voice acting, all things considered, is pretty good; i feel sorry for the actors though.. I'll bet some of them cringed the whole way through this.

Gameplay 4/10
Graphics 6.5/10
SFX 7/10

Ok I'm sorry, this is just not the game for me personally.
Before it I have played Fallout 4 and Fallout New Vegas for around 350 hours altogether. But it took me only 12 hours to complete Bioshock Infinite.
I admit the graphics and the whole environment (sky city) are excellent indeed (10/10), and the story is interesting and twisted, just a bit to much religious blah blah for me.
But the rest is not what I prefer and like.
NO freedom or side quests, NO open world, NO character stats/skills (few spells though), NO experience and levelling (you could loot coins and in some locations buy simple weapons upgrades), NO inventory, only TWO weapons at the same time with very limited ammo limits, automatic saves only at certain points - simply respawn there if you got killed...
The game is nice if you know what to expect from the gameplay point of view. It's a quest game with elements of FPS. Hope you enjoy it.
有中途卡住情况的可以试试把输入法切换到纯英文输入法（不是中文输入法shift或者CapsLock）。画面非常精致，天空之城太美了，最后玩到结局真的是鸡皮疙瘩都起来了，一下子眼泪都收不住。神作。
剧情极其优秀，不过最后的画面没能好好映入我的眼眸，只因为泪水早已让视线模糊。
O design dos niveis e a arte do jogo é incrivel. É sempre divertido reviver o jogo e passar pela experiência novamente, e sempre reparo em algo novo.... Vale muito a pena.

神作不用多讲了，FPS与史诗剧情完美结合，建筑，道具服装等等的观赏性很强，还有最好的AI伊丽莎白，不过还涉及了很多ZZ方面的敏感话题，这方面不多说，建议细品，我只是大概描述了一下，还有很多地方没有说到，建议入手直接体验，BTW，买了无限建议也把前两作买了，毕竟天空城哥伦比亚像一座美丽的城堡内藏许多阴谋，但总体艺术基调还是偏向于明亮，但是身处海底的销魂城，则是从内而外的一个秘密，更加黑暗，甚至还有恐怖元素，个人也是由无限入了销魂城的坑，最终居然还更偏向于销魂城一点，而无限的DLC海葬则从第三作绕回去把前两作串联起来，非常巧妙，不管怎么说，这几部作品都是值得一遍又一遍，细细品味的难得佳作，买它！最后说一下，之所以只玩了9个小时，是因为以前用的游民正版，已经通关好几遍了，现在来补票重温经典。
哪那么多屁话，都给老子玩。

This game really embraces the previous gameplay styles used in the series, as well as expands upon them with new mechanics and powers, as well as a compelling storyline. I very much enjoyed playing it.

Generic shooter aside from the salts, but the story, atmosphere, sound design, music, and graphics make it top notch for the series.... and games in general. Worth playing through once at least, and holds up well enough here in 2020.

Great atmosphere, addictive gameplay, amazing world building, superb voice acting and multiple endings? This is the best Bioshock game to date!

If Steam had a ‘neutral’ option for reviews, that’s exactly what Bioshock Infinite would get.   Be very careful before you decide to purchase this game.

I’m basing my “Like” recommendation mainly on the gameplay and the colorful and interesting world.  I’ve always felt that gameplay was the most important detail to a video game.  Your story doesn’t have to make sense if your game is still fun to play.  That’s the only reason Bioshock Infinite (hereon referred to as BI) passes.

So lets start with helping you make a choice on whether or not you want to buy this game.

If you’re a former player of Bioshock 1 & 2, you should know that the base game of BI only barely belongs in the Bioshock family.  The reason it fits is more or less 3 minor details.   Then the Burial At Sea DLC’s tries to conveniently join Bioshock 1 to BI in ways that I don’t really find satisfactory, but it’s hard to be clear about these things without spoilers.

If story means a great deal to you, then you might have some problems with this one. 

A lot of proponents for this game’s story want you to believe it’s really in depth and you have to have a certain intellect to understand it.

I played through the entire game, I played through the 2 story DLCs, I read the wikis and then I went through and read a good number of online message boards, youtube videos, and reviews before posting this, and my doctor says I’m smart enough to figure it out.

It’s not entirely as full of itself as a David Lynch film, but it comes pretty close.   The ideas that the game presents makes sense in terms of the lore the game has given and in terms of the timelines, but a lot of it doesn't make a whole bunch of sense in terms of reality.  In other words, just because they explain something, doesn’t mean their explanation is good, or even satisfying.  In addition, a lot of the story is left out, mainly the reasons for the character’s motivations.   It also introduces themes like racism and religion, but then abandons them and leaves them unanswered.

One of the main characters, “Elizabeth” is a mary sue, who conveniently makes everything work.  The previous games had surprises in them, but BI tries to act smarter than everyone else in the room.   Even the PC.  Your character, “Booker” isn’t smart enough to pick up what’s going on, despite certain things that should be blatantly obvious.  Levine (the creator) uses Booker’s stupidity to fill in a bunch of exposition.

The game is extremely cinematic, with long stretches where you can’t do anything but walk along and fill in the story.    If your character gets in an elevator, you’re guaranteed to get a conversation filled with more exposition.   

Another point that really frustrated me is that there are audio tapes called voxphones littered about the world to give exposition just like the first two games, but while they help YOU figure out what’s going on, the PC and his companion Elizabeth are oblivious to these messages and plod along with their fixed story regardless of whether or not their questions were answered.  The bottom line is, I’m not impressed with any of the stories from BI, the base game, or the DLC’s.

The visuals and sound are hit or miss.  The towns, creatures, and settings are the most impressive part of this game.   But other parts are less impressive.  Many of the “civilian” NPC’s are terrible looking, particularly the children.  I felt like they improved that in the DLC.   

The sound is about as good as any other game, but the mechanics of the sound are off.  What I mean is, with stereo headphones on, sound seemed to travel through walls and solid objects in ways they shouldn’t.  In addition, there are many conflicts… start listening to an audio tape (in game) and then have it get cut off for a cinematic.   Have your PC start talking, cutting off your audio tape.  I very often would wait until I was certain nothing was going to happen before listening to the voxphones because the minute I picked one up, the PC would have a conversation.

I personally found the gameplay very good, but the pacing between story and actually doing something was rough.  If you find yourself exploring and engaging in the world without fighting then there’s a good chance either there’s some enemies waiting for you, or you’re about to engage in a cinematic again.  It’s fairly predictable in that respect, and the abrupt changes back and forth weren’t really something I enjoyed all that much.

You should also be aware that the vast majority of the game is an escort mission.   It feels a bit unnecessary for Elizabeth to tag along with you, but they gave her some peripheral reasons for being with you.  In the base game she pretty much stays out of your way and can be helpful.

The FPS action again I found really satisfying, but I also could see a lot of people not enjoying it.  To be plain, it’s pretty easy to get through each area and the plasmids that make a return from previous games would be nearly unnecessary if ammunition wasn’t an issue.   In the DLC’s in particular, the amount of ammo you carry is frustratingly low, with only 1 or 2 guns having an option to upgrade.  There are a number of plasmids I never used at all except to see what they did.   Some of them I couldn’t even figure out and didn’t bother.  A brief cinematic (again) shows up when you pick them up explaining what they’re [u]supposed[/u] to do, but that doesn’t make their mechanics easy to figure out.

I’m also going to point out that Burial at Sea Episode 2 changes the gameplay entirely to an Arkham City clone, complete with Detective Mode, minus the hit combos.

If you’re wondering should I buy the DLC’s, well… I understand Clash of Clouds is some kind of Arena battle, so even though I got the season pass, I didn’t bother with it.   

Columbia’s Finest gives you some extra gear and money to start out with.  The gear was really good, and I rarely swapped it out for something else as the game went on.

Burial at Sea 1 & 2 work very hard to tie BI to Bioshock 1.  It also retcons a certain set of events from BI for reasons that are unclear.  It feels more like fan service than a compelling story to me.   The game mechanics don’t work nearly as well in the DLC’s.  Elizabeth often blocks your way, there’s an airlock that won’t open if you come back to it a second time, and the skyrails seem a lot more unforgiving than the base game.   It's still worth buying if you get the game on sale.   It's not a bad amount of content for the money and at least you can see where Levine went with the story.

All-in-all, if I had to evaluate my purchase, I am ok with it.   I found the story increasingly frustrating as it went on, but the gameplay was interesting and I still wanted to know just where they were going to go with the story.

But this game is not for everyone.   Keep that in mind before you buy.

Best of all BioShock games. 

Combat mechanics are less repetitive and story is will rounded so you fell less on fetch quest, than in previous two games. 10-15 years ago, I would not feel that any of Bioshock games has repetitive combat mechanics, but as I've grown older and time got scarce, I rarely find FPS to be interesting games.... and I bought some games years ago and they slowly enter my "to play list" by certain priorities. 

Bioshock Infinite was definitely game that I had to play, and even though I had troubles motivating myself to start it, it's by far the best game in series and I ended up enjoying the game. 

24 hrs playthrough was OK for me, could have been faster, but I tend to play games and try to see all it has to offer.
玩了这么多款游戏，生化奇兵的场景构造是我见过最惊艳的，剧情也非常天马行空，可能没玩过前作不是很了解布克和世界观，直到通关还是懵逼的，越到后面就越玩不懂了，剧情还是非常紧凑的，我个人最喜欢的半开放线性游戏。我应该去补补前作了，刚好psn会免送了合集。

꽤 재밌었다. 괜히 명작인 게 아니더라..
오랜만에 스토리에 집중할 수 있었던 게임이었다. 물론 복소폰을 열심히 모으면서도 어려워서 이해가 잘 안됐지만 단편들을 더듬으면서 유튭정리본을 보니 정말 짜임새있고 복선회수가 완벽한 스토리여서 놀랐다. 
매력적인 히로인도 좋았다. 2편의 앨리노가 진화한 느낌이었다. 앨리노는 갇혀있고 구하러 갈 때까지는 상호작용이 안 됐지만 엘리자베스는 계속 함께하면서 그만큼 대화도 많아지고 전투시 상호작용도 다양했기 때문이다. 덕분에 적적했던 1 2에 비해 활기찬?모험이 될 수 있었다.
또 스토리만큼 훌륭한 아트덕분에 질리지 않는 파밍이 가능했다. 2는 하면서 파밍이 지겨웠는데, 인피도 같은 일직선진행이지만 길을 갈 때나 전투가 끝난뒤의 구조물이 너무 이뻐서 보면서 느긋하게 주울 거 주우니 파밍시간이 슉지나갔다.
전투는 상호작용으로 쓰는 차원구조물이나 스카이라인 공중전이 너무 인상깊었다. 은엄폐를 활용한 개활지 전투가 
주를 이루는데, 스카이라인을 타고 기습뒤치를 하거나 상대가 너무 버거우면 타고 튀어서 차원구조물과 함께 새로운 싸움을 유도할 수 있다. 
1 2의 얼음땡처럼 인피에서는 까마귀덕을 많이봤다. 경직이 거의 무한이라 초반에 들고 시작하면 막히는 구간도 치트급으로 뚫을 수 있다ㅋㅋ
이제 dlc하고 4 기다리면 되겠다..ㅎㅎ
The game play, The story, the ending. Simply Superb

不愧是第九艺术
场景设计，关卡设计，队友ai以及bgm完全让我挑不出毛病，剧情紧凑，以至于让我在三天内就通关了。游戏中部分场景就像印在了脑海中以至于过了这么长时间也能够清晰回忆起来。
比较遗憾的是最后一关因为手残实在打不下去了便从困难难度调到了普通难度，以至于少了一个成就。
完全值得多周目的体验。等以后有时间了（划重点）一定要把隐藏难度通关一遍（With 攻略），顺便把dlc给通关XD
this game will break you, in the best way

Бесспорно и безусловно это лучшая игра всех времён и народов для меня. Это невероятно насыщенный шутер, с динамичной боёвкой, глубоким и нетривиальным сюжетом, по настоящему живыми персонажами и незабываемой и тёплой атмосферой.
В игровых механиках много нового по сравнению с прошлыми играми серии: на тяжёлом уровне сложности заставляет попотеть и пользоваться всем что видишь, быть более подвижным и находчивым. Так что ограничения здесь к месту.
Сюжет гораздо драматичнее и проницательнее, чем в прошлых играх серии + если добавить ещё DLC, то вообще отвал башки (в хорошем смысле). По графике на 2020 год всё смотрится превосходно и не старо, а тёплый и объёмный свет можно ощущать и по сей день.
Никогда об этой игре не скажу ничего плохо, потому что это настоящий шедевр и Кен Левин просто боженька. А Элизабет, ах, просто мечта, просто ангел
10h完结，这游戏是个充满政治思想色彩的艺术品，伊丽莎白很可爱，建议入坑一试
多年之后重新游玩,我还是觉得这是我玩过的最推荐的游戏
生化奇兵无限，牛逼就完事了
очень хорошая игра всем советую))
